snippet: After years of warnings, the central bank governor, Mervyn A. King, said a recovery was “in sight.” Unemployment, however, rose in the first quarter.
abstract: Bank of England governor Mervyn A King says Britain's economy could grow by 0.5 percent in second quarter after growing 0.3 percent in first quarter; says recovery is 'in sight.'
lead_paragraph: After years of warnings, the central bank governor, Mervyn A. King, said a recovery was “in sight.” Unemployment, however, rose in the first quarter.

headline.seo: Bank of England Raises Outlook for Economy
headline.main: Bank of England Raises Outlook for British Economy
headline.print_headline: Bank of England Raises Outlook for British Economy
